Key Match Events: The Dodgers put up four runs on five hits in the fourth, extending their lead to 5-0.
Chris Taylor singled and Gavin Lux had a ground-rule double to open the inning before both scored on Austin Barnes' RBI double in his first game back from the injured list.
Barnes scored on Mookie Betts' single.
Burch Smith came on and gave up an RBI single to Miguel Rojas.
The Orioles closed to 5-3 in the fifth on Colton Cowser’s three-run shot, just their second hit of the game.
Tommy Edman's sacrifice fly with two outs extended their lead to 6-3 in the eighth.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Japanese superstar Shohei Ohtani flied out four times and was retired on a called third strike one night after he hit his 42nd home run and stole his 41st and 42nd bases.
The Dodgers rapped out 14 hits while winning for the eighth time in 10 games.
Every Dodger except Ohtani had a hit.
Orioles starter Cade Povich (1-7) gave up five runs and 10 hits, struck out three and walked one.
Others: Freddie Freeman returns Friday at Arizona after missing three games to rest his broken right middle finger.
RHP Zach Eflin (shoulder) could be in line to start Sunday at Colorado for the Orioles.
LHP Danny Coulombe (biceps) has resumed throwing off the mound for the Orioles.
RHP Albert Suárez (6-4, 3.18 ERA) makes his first start at Colorado since 2017 on Friday for the Orioles.
LHP Clayton Kershaw (2-2, 3.72) starts Friday for the Dodgers.
